translated: Here, having spoken to each other in this way, the king of the garuḍas, the lord of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, and the many hundreds of thousands of gods, surrounded by their many mansions and geese, approach the vast lotus lake.

analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas rol mo'i sgra dang rnga sgra dang glu dang bcas pas mchog tu dge bar gyur pa la sems kyis kun nas bde bar @359b gtogs pa'i yid dri ma med par gyur pas bag dang ldan par rgyu ba dang / de bzhin du rnam pa de srid kyi bag med pa'i sa rnams la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i 'od zer gyi mchog dang ldan par gyur pa rnams rnga sgra dang ldan par song nas rnam par yangs pa'i ming can gyi rdzing 'dir zhugs par gyur to //

Accompanied by the sound of drums, they enter this lake called Vast.

original: de nas phyin par gyur pa dang lha gzhan ches rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis padma'i rdzing bu der rtsed mo rtse ba rnams kun nas legs par mthong bar gyur pas rtsed mo rab tu rtse bar rtsom mo //

translated: “When they arrive, the gods, with minds filled with supreme joy, see the other gods who are playing in the lotus lake. They join in the games.

original: rtse bar gyur pa'i lha de dag rnams thams cad kyis kyang sgra 'thug po'i sgra kun nas sgrog par byed pa bzhin du nam mkha'i dkyil de dag rnams thams cad nas thos par gyur te /

analyzed: thos nas yid 'phrog par byed pa dang / des khro ba med par byed pa dang / rna ba dang yid 'phrog par byed pa rnams so //

original: de nas phyin par gyur pa de dag rnams thams cad padma'i rdzing bu'i bde ba 'dod pa dang yad yud tsam zhig nye bar bral zhing de dag rnams thams cad sgra'ang med par gyur pa dang / rnam pa de srid kyi lha rdzas kyi yul rnams kyis kyang khrid par ma gyur cing g-yo bar gyur ba'i sems kyang chos la gus pas kun tu gnas pas g-yo ba med pa'i sems su gyur cing /

translated: Then, all those who have arrived, with their desire for the bliss of the lotus pools suddenly gone, and with all that sound gone, are led by such divine objects to a place where there is no sound. analyzed: dang / byas par gyur pa'i las rnams chud mi 'dza' ba la kun tu bltas nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rgyal po de la 'thab bral gyi bdag po des 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “ ‘The king who travels through the sky will now see that the actions he has performed will not go to waste. The ruler of the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife will then say to him:

original: ji ltar dus bzang lags pas chos bstan par byed pa'i dus 'di bzang po yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dus bzang lags pas chos bstan par byed pa'i dus 'di bzang po yin te /

original: bzang po lags so //

analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: bag med par gyur pas bag med par spyod pa /
analyzed: bag med par gyur pas bag med par spyod pa /

analyzed: de'ang snying po med pa don med par byed pa po snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal ba ye ye'o //
translated: They are insubstantial and meaningless, and they contradict what came before and what follows.🔽They do not hold the attention of others.

translated: “What have I said? How have I said it? To whom have I said it?🔽” In this way, his mind becomes distracted and unstable, and he speaks incoherently.

analyzed: de de ltar yang mor 'gyur ro; ;yongs las kha nyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes unsteady and unreliable.

analyzed: yid du mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan dag rnams kyis kyang rnam par gshe bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnams kyis kyang rnam par gshe bar byed do //

original: de thams cad la rtsva bzhin du bdag nyid 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: de thams cad la rtsva bzhin du bdag nyid 'dud par byed do //

original: 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni /

analyzed: skyon dang po yin te /

analyzed: bag med pas kun tu bcings pa'i skyon rnams kyis kyang log par ltung ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba ni /

analyzed: 'gro ba gsum po rnams phan tshun du gang yang rung ba rnams su'o //

analyzed: 'di ni / bag med pa rnams kyi skyon gyi dang po yin no //

original: gzhan yang bag med pa rnams la skyon gnyis pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bag med pa rnams la skyon gnyis pa yod de /
translated: “ ‘There is also a second fault of the careless.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: dgos pa dang dgos pa ma yin pa rnams kyang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa dang dgos pa ma yin pa rnams kyang mi shes pa'o //
translated: They do not know what is necessary and what is not.

original: bag med pas nyams par gyur pa'i blos rtogs par mi 'gyur te /🔽bdag gi legs par byas pa'i don rnams ni /
analyzed: bag med pas nyams par gyur pa'i blos rtogs par mi 'gyur te / bdag gi legs par byas pa'i don rnams ni /
translated: The careless mind does not understand.

original: ci yin / ci ni /
analyzed: ci yin / ci ni /
translated: “ ‘What is the purpose of my good actions?

original: bya ba ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa yin /
translated: What is not to be done?

original: de'i las de dag rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de'i las de dag rnams kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: What are the results of those actions?

original: rnam pa ci 'dra bzhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa ci 'dra bzhig tu 'gyur /
translated: What will they be like?

original: de ji ltar las rnams shes pa ma yin pa de de @361a *//
analyzed: de ji ltar las rnams shes pa ma yin pa de de @361a *//
translated: Since they do not know their actions,

original: ltar rnam par smin pa rnams kyang mi shes so //
analyzed: ltar rnam par smin pa rnams kyang mi shes so //
translated: they also do not know their ripening.

original: de las dang 'bras bu rnams la rnam par rmongs par gyur cing rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de las dang 'bras bu rnams la rnam par rmongs par gyur cing rmongs pa ni /
translated: They are confused about actions and results.

analyzed: lus zhig par gyur nas bag med pa de'i skyon gyis ngan song log par ltung bar gyur pa dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When their bodies disintegrate, they fall into the lower realms due to the fault of carelessness, and are born in the hells.

original: gzhan yang skyon gsum pa bag med pa la yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon gsum pa bag med pa la yod de /
translated: “ ‘There is a third problem related to carelessness:

original: bag med pa la kun tu 'khrid par gyur pa'i lha'am mi rnams kyang rung ste /🔽grogs po dam pa ma yin pa sten par byed la /
analyzed: bag med pa la kun tu 'khrid par gyur pa'i lha'am mi rnams kyang rung ste / grogs po dam pa ma yin pa sten par byed la /
translated: Whether one is a god or a human, carelessness leads one to associate with bad friends.

original: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen par mi byed pa dang / shes rab dang tshul khrims la'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen par mi byed pa dang / shes rab dang tshul khrims la'ang ma yin /
translated: One will not serve the Three Jewels, nor will one serve wisdom and discipline.

original: bla ma rnams la sten par mi byed do //
analyzed: bla ma rnams la sten par mi byed do //
translated: One will not serve the gurus.

original: skyon dang yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyang kun tu mi shes so //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan gyi khyad par rnams kyang kun tu mi shes so //
translated: One will not understand the difference between faults and qualities.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not understand the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: las rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyang kun tu mi rtogs so //
analyzed: las rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyang kun tu mi rtogs so //
translated: One will not understand the various types of karmic actions.

original: srod dang tho rangs mi nyal bar brtson par gnas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
analyzed: srod dang tho rangs mi nyal bar brtson par gnas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin no //
translated: One will not be diligent in staying awake during the first and last periods of the night.

analyzed: de shi bar gyur pa'i 'og tu bag med pa de'i skyon gyis ngan song log par ltung ba dmyal bar skye'o //
translated: After his death, due to the fault of his heedlessness, he will fall into the lower realms and be born in hell.

original: gzhan yang skyon bzhi pa bag med pa la yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon bzhi pa bag med pa la yod de /
translated: “ ‘There is a fourth problem related to heedlessness.

original: de gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is it?

original: de kho nar skyes par gyur pa'i skyes bu rnams dang / lha rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed rnams zad par 'gyur zhing legs par byas pa'i las @361b rnams zad par gyur nas ni /
analyzed: de kho nar skyes par gyur pa'i skyes bu rnams dang / lha rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed rnams zad par 'gyur zhing legs par byas pa'i las @361b rnams zad par gyur nas ni /
translated: The gods and humans who are born in this world will, in the same way, exhaust their life force and their positive karmic actions.

original: 'chi bdag gi rgyal po 'ong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi rgyal po 'ong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Then the Lord of Death will come.

original: gang dang lhan cig tu skyes par gyur pa'i bag med pa sten par byed pa rnams la de dang lhan cig tu rnam par 'bral bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bzhi po 'di dag rnams gang yin pa dang ni /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig tu skyes par gyur pa'i bag med pa sten par byed pa rnams la de dang lhan cig tu rnam par 'bral bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro // bzhi po 'di dag rnams gang yin pa dang ni /

translated: The vines are covered with flowers and are frequented by flocks of birds that are always captivating.🔽The vines are beautiful with their hanging vines, waterfalls, ponds, pools, cascades, groves of trees, vine-covered houses, and flower beds.

original: rnam par rtog pa du mas nags kyi rgyal po rnam par bkra ba 'khri shing kun nas 'khris pas dga' ba'i sa gzhi shin tu dga' bar gyur pas shin tu bar rnam par snang ngo //

translated: The king of the forest shines with its many vines and is delightful with its many conceptions.

original: lha'i tshogs gzhan dag brgya phrag rnams kyis kyang lan gcig ma yin par bsten par gyur pa /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs gzhan dag brgya phrag rnams kyis kyang lan gcig ma yin par bsten par gyur pa /

analyzed: 'khri shing gi khang pa dang padma'i rdzing bu dang chu klung gi ngos dang 'bab chu dang sman ljongs dang ljon shing gi tshang tshing rnams bsten par gyur pas ches dga' bar gyur pa /

analyzed: bde ba'i don du nags kyi me tog rnams rab tu g-yo bar gyur pa ni /

analyzed: rlung legs par rab tu g-yo bas me tog gi rgyan rgyun rnams 'byang zhing rab tu bskyod par byed par gyur pa rnams ni /

analyzed: rab tu gar byed pa bzhin du nags de dag rnams thams cad ches lhag par rnam par snang bar gyur pas lham me'o // de nas lha de dag rnams nags der zhugs par gyur pa dang yid bzhin du ngo mtshar zhing yid ches rab tu rangs bar yang gyur nas phyir zhing nyid kyang kun tu rtsom pa lta bur @371a *//
translated: The forest is radiant with the gods’ splendor, as if it were dancing.🔽Then, the gods enter the forest. They are amazed, delighted, and overjoyed. They are like friends who have come together to help each other.

original: gyur pa'i yid kyis phan tshun grogs byas par gyur nas rgyags pa la don gcig pa rnams gar byed do //🔽rgod par byed do //
analyzed: gyur pa'i yid kyis phan tshun grogs byas par gyur nas rgyags pa la don gcig pa rnams gar byed do // rgod par byed do //

original: glu len par byed do //
analyzed: glu len par byed do //

original: rtag tu yang yul rnams la phyogs par gyur pa'i yid dang / bag med pa la 'gro bar byed pa'i yid kyis nags kyi gseb rnams su rtag tu lha mo rnams dang rtse bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu yang yul rnams la phyogs par gyur pa'i yid dang / bag med pa la 'gro bar byed pa'i yid kyis nags kyi gseb rnams su rtag tu lha mo rnams dang rtse bar byed do //
translated: With minds constantly focused on objects and intent on carelessness, they play with the goddesses in the forest.

analyzed: de de ltar rtse bar gyur pas nags nas nags rnams su dga' bar gyur pa las gal te shed na mand'a ra ba'i tshal du phyin te /
translated: As he frolics in this way, enjoying himself from forest to forest, he will at some point arrive at a forest of wish-fulfilling trees.

analyzed: rin po che bdun gyis nye bar spras par gyur pa'i bcud du gyur cing snying por gyur pa nags de'i rgyal po lta bur gyur pa /
translated: This forest is the king of forests, adorned with the seven precious substances, filled with the essence of the nectar of existence,

analyzed: nyi ma brgya bas lhag pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis rnam par mdzes par gyur pa'i padma'i rdzing bu'i dbus su 'gro bar byed de /

analyzed: de nas yang mand'a ra ba'i shing ljon pa la rnam par bkra ba zhes bya ba'i rma bya'i rgyal po rab tu gnas so //
translated: “ ‘In the wish-fulfilling trees there lives a peacock king called Colorful.

original: thig le bdun gyis rnam par bkra bar gyur pa'i sgro mgrin pa'i dbyangs shin tu snyan pa dang ldan pas nags ma lus pa rnams gang bar byed de /
analyzed: thig le bdun gyis rnam par bkra bar gyur pa'i sgro mgrin pa'i dbyangs shin tu snyan pa dang ldan pas nags ma lus pa rnams gang bar byed de /

original: bag med pa'i lha rnams kyi bag med pa gdul bar bya ba'i don du smon lam gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' der skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: bag med pa'i lha rnams kyi bag med pa gdul bar bya ba'i don du smon lam gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' der skyes pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are born there by the power of their aspirations in order to tame the careless gods.

original: lha de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: lha de dag rnams ni /

analyzed: yul lnga'i mi rnams kyi dbus su song ba'i phyir na 'dod chags kyi mes 'di na bsregs @371b bar gyur pa rnams kun tu mngon par mthong nas ljon shing gi yal ga'i bar du song nas rab tu brtan pa'i 'gros kyis rjes su thugs brtse bar gyur pas
translated: see that they are being burned by the fire of attachment, and so they go to the branches of the trees and, with a very steady gait, out of compassion

analyzed: lha de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: they say to the gods:

original: lha 'di dag rnams ni /
analyzed: lha 'di dag rnams ni /

analyzed: de dag rnams kyi bde ba 'di dag rnams las shin tu 'da' bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'di dag rnams skad cig pa yin zhing brtan pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams kyi bde ba thams cad ni /

analyzed: rab tu ltung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: ri gzar po'i chu'i bang dang 'dra bar shin tu 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rmi lam don //

analyzed: chu yi chu bur dang 'dra ba //

original: las la lha rnams lhung ba yin //

analyzed: 'dod pa la ni lha rnams lhung //

analyzed: 'dod pa la ni lha rnams ltung //

original: 'dod pa la ni lha rnams ltung //
analyzed: 'dod pa la ni lha rnams ltung //

analyzed: de rtag tu mngon par dga' ba'i nags su zhugs par gyur pa'i lha de dag rnams la des rjes su ston par byed do //

translated: The peacock king, who was endowed with the most virtuous thoughts, was reborn in that god realm due to the power of his aspirations.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /

analyzed: rgyu gang gis lha de dag rnams kyis cung zad thos par gyur pas skye ba gzhan rnams rjes su dran par gyur cing /

analyzed: de las kyi 'bras bu de dag rnams rjes su dran par gyur nas rtag tu sgom par byed pa dang / de shin tu lhag par yang 'dod pa rnams la sgrub par mi byed pa dang / de ltar byas pas kyang mi bzhin du rtag tu so sor 'gyod pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Remembering the results of their actions, they will always meditate on them and will not pursue desires to an excessive degree.

translated: The faults of desire were also well explained. Some of those gods heard this and remembered their other lives.

original: de las de las rnams kyi 'bras bu rjes su dran par gyur nas yud tsam zhig 'dod pa rnams la bag med pa dang ldan par mi byed do //
analyzed: de las de las rnams kyi 'bras bu rjes su dran par gyur nas yud tsam zhig 'dod pa rnams la bag med pa dang ldan par mi byed do //
translated: Remembering the results of their actions, they did not become careless with regard to desire for even a moment.

original: dge ba rjes su dran pa'ang kun tu skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba rjes su dran pa'ang kun tu skyes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: pa'i byang chub sems dpas rnam par bkra ba des tshigs su bcad pa de dag rnams bshad pa'i rgyus byas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is engaged in benefiting others composed these verses with that purpose in mind.

analyzed: de nas slar yang dbang po de nyid kyis kun nas khrid par gyur nas nags de nyid kun tu lta bar rtsom par byed de /

translated: On their heads are garlands of lotuses, shining with their own light and adorned with divine ornaments. They are intoxicated by the sound of the five types of musical instruments.

original: nags de na ni /
analyzed: nags de na ni /
translated: In that forest

original: rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i shing ljon pa dang / 'bras bu dang chu klung dang 'bab chu dang rdzing bu dang chu mig rnams phun sum tshogs par gyur pa rnams shin tu khyad par du 'phags par yid dga' bar gyur pa rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i shing ljon pa dang / 'bras bu dang chu klung dang 'bab chu dang rdzing bu dang chu mig rnams phun sum tshogs par gyur pa rnams shin tu khyad par du 'phags par yid dga' bar gyur pa rnams mthong ngo //
translated: they see the most abundant trees, fruits, rivers, waterfalls, ponds, and springs, all of the highest quality and delightful.

analyzed: lha rnams bag med par gyur pa la ro gcig tu byas nas skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang rnam par bral bar gyur pas /

original: de dag rnams de ltar gar byed par gyur cing /
analyzed: de dag rnams de ltar gar byed par gyur cing /
